answers.answer: Hi, firstly one needs to rule out the type of incontinence i.e. urge incontinence, Stress incontinence or mixed incontinence. The causes are Urinary tract infection (symptomatic with frequency, urgency, pain etc).The therapy includes Bladder training, Pelvic muscle exercises, Electrical stimulation devices and anti-cholinergic can help to alleviate the condition.As for bowel incontinence is concerned causes are dysfunction of the anal sphincters, surgical trauma, Diabetes mellitus, decreased rectal compliance, Impaired rectal sensation and Fecal impaction. Treatment of cause is important.If it is due to diarrhea, then loperamide against prescription will be helpful. Anticholinergic agents may be helpful in, who tend to have leakage of stools after eating.  Low doses of the tricyclic antidepressant amitriptyline can improve symptoms in few patients.These drugs should be taken only after consultation from physician. Take care and regards.
